page-title-container.description: The one and only organization associated to your Solar Insights account.

help-subtitle-container.description: Contact one of your organization's administrator.

delete-user.title: Do you really want to delete this user?

page-title-container.title: Drive adoption of solar energy with Solar Insights
page-title-container.description: Easy to use, highly adaptive, and accurate. Observe the viability of solar installations in one single search.
page-title-container.action: Get started on your Solar journey!

usecase-subtitle-container.subtitle: What can you do with Solar Insights?

visualize.title: Visualize accurate solar data
visualize.description: Observe estimations of the optimal placement for solar panels on a building's roof. Plus, get information on its daily, monthly, or yearly sunshine patterns.

customize.title: Customize and optimize solar installations
customize.description: Optimize a solar installation to fit your budget and needs. You can also adjust most settings manually.

viability.title: Assess the viability of solar panels
viability.description: Customize financial parameters to find out the economic value of solar panels over their lifespan.

collaborate.title: Collaborate with members of your organization
collaborate.description: By being part of an organization, you will be able to collaborate efficiently with your colleagues. Share data, solar installations, and even visual content.

page-title-container.title: Get started with Solar Insights
page-title-container.precision: A quick guide to kickstart your journey.
page-title-container.action: Don't need a guide, or already a member? Start using Solar Insights!

manage.title: Handle all user access
manage.description: Maintain your own list of allowed users to fit your organizational needs.

share.title: Share insights with colleagues
share.description: Send your Solar Insights' discoveries to colleagues with a simple link.

help.title: Collaborate with users
help.description: Find your organization's admin(s) and members in a matter of seconds and start collaborating.

create-an-org-paragraph.content: To create an organization and gain access to every Solar Insights' features:

new-org.title: Preliminary step
new-org.description: You need to login to start using Solar Insights and its range of tools.

start-using.title: Get started
start-using.description: Start a building research now to benefit from everything Solar Insights has to offer.

beyond-solar-insights-subtitle-container.subtitle: 3. Go beyond Solar Insights
beyond-solar-insights-subtitle-container.precision: Make the most of our data, even outside the app.

data.title: Export valuable data
data.description: Save relevant Solar Insights data on your device to reuse later, or even integrate with different tools.

graphs.title: Save charts and other visual content
graphs.description: Use integrated tools to save clean and presentable visual content of solar installations and data.

pricing.title: Simple and unsurpricing pricing
pricing.precision: Pay only for what you need

starter.name: Starter
starter.description: Ideal for new users and a moderate usage

pro.name: Pro
pro.description: Work with your team and all existing tools in a scaling environnment
pro.benefits-title: Everything in the Starter plan, plus:

enterprise.name: Enterprise
enterprise.description: For large-scale usage with dedicated servers
enterprise.benefits-title: Everything in the Pro plan, plus:

pricing-model-subtitle-container.subtitle: Our hybrid pricing model
pricing-model-subtitle-container.precision: The explanation behind a mix of fixed and variable pricing

introduction-paragraph.content: Our goal at Solar Insights is to charge our customers for what they really need and use on a monthly basis. An hybrid pricing model gives us the opportunity to do exactly that, while keeping our services available at any moment you might need them.

fixed-costs-paragraph.content: The fixed monthly costs allow us to provide services that are available 24/7 to every organization registered on Solar Insights. Aspects like the number of users and the expected server load is accounted in the pricing.

variable-costs-paragraph.content: The variable monthly costs based on usage allow us to guarantee our users that they only pay for what they use. This frees you from the costs and complexities of planning and esimating your monthly usage across an entire organization.

usage-pricing-subtitle-container.subtitle: Usage pricing
usage-pricing-subtitle-container.precision: More info about your monthly variable costs

confusion-paragraph.content: With Solar Insight's hybrid pricing model, you might get confused about what will be charged to you at the end of the month. It is understandable. To help with that, the organization's administrator will always receive a detailed monthly report of the charges.

what-is-included-paragraph.content: Here is a detailed breakdown of every action that incurs a charge on a monthly bill:
what-is-included-paragraph.depends-on-the-plan: Price / unit depends on the chosen plan

charges.building-insights-request: Accessing the solar installation analysis page (the map)
charges.additional-users: Create an additional user after reaching the plan's limit, and if the plan allows it

what-is-not-included-paragraph.content: Here are examples of actions that DO NOT incur any additional charge:

non-charges.title: Modifiying a solar installation once already on the map page
Managing your organization while respecting your plan's limit
Save data or charts to your local device

not-logged-in.action: Sign in to gain insights on a building

step-1.title: Find a building
step-1.content-1: Use the above text field to locate buildings. You will be redirected to the map to start creating a new solar installation.

step-2.title: Gain insights on a solar installation
step-2.content-1: Once redirected, take a look at the Solar Insights panel. It displays valuable informations about the solar installation of building. By default, the installation is optimized to maximize total savings.

step-3.title: Customize a solar installation
step-3.content-1: Two sections enable you to customize your installation and parameters used for their analysis. Make adjustments to these sections to better reflect your unique situation.
step-3.content-2: The Panels section contains parameters like the power rating and the yearly efficiency decline of panels. They have been prefilled with industry-standard values.
step-3.content-3: The Cost and incentives section incorporates financial data for the average Canadian household.

step-4.title: Optimize a solar installation
step-4.content-1: The Optimizations section is aimed at users wishing to optimize the current solar installation for a specific criteria. Select the one you prefer, and see the changes for yourself!

step-5.title: Adjust the look and feel of the map
step-5.content-1: The Settings section gives you the ability to enable / disable the visbility of certain map elements like the panels. Also, you can use the drop-down menu to display monthly or daily solar patterns.

step-6.title: Share and save data
step-6.content-1: Use the toolbar to share data to an organization member, save it on your device for future use, and more.

panels.name: Panels
panels.description: Solar panels are ordered from most to least efficient based on the annual sunlight received of the roof (e.g. an installation of 10 panels will use the 10 most efficient ones)

costs.name: Costs and Incentives
costs.description: Costs and incentives are used to evaluate the financial benefits of solar panels for a specific building

optimizations.name: Optimizations
optimizations.description: Automatically update the panel's count to optimize the configuration for a specific criteria.

total-savings.name: Maximize total savings
total-savings.description: Configuration providing the highest savings at the end of the installation's lifespan. Used by default on new queries.

energy-covered.name: Maximize energy covered
energy-covered.description: Configuration covering the most of the building's annual energy needs, or the first configuration that covers it all.

settings.name: Settings
settings.description: Settings to control what information is currently being displayed on the map

building-readonly.name: Building Attributes
building-readonly.based-on: Based on 3D analysis of the roof
building-readonly.derived-from: Derived from daily examination of weather patterns
